A

add(String...) - Method in class util.Args
Creates a Matcher for a "named" argument.
add(Function<String, T>, String...) - Method in class util.Args
An enhanced version of add(String...) allowing validation and conversion of parameters from String to other types.
add() - Method in class util.Args
Creates a "wildcard" Matcher for unnamed parameters; the classic use case is "grep expr file1 file2 fileN", which lets you provide a search expression as well as files to search through without something like "-expr" and "-files" preceding them.
add(Function<String, T>) - Method in class util.Args
An enhanced version of add() allowing validation and conversion of unnamed parameters from String to other types.
addError(Args.Matcher<?>, String) - Method in class util.Args
Just a way to add arbitrary user errors (such as special validation cases beyond the scope of Args itself) while keeping errors centralized.
Args - Class in util
A single-file (as in, just one java file) utility for parsing & validating command-line arguments, as well as printing detailed help and error messages for users.
Args() - Constructor for class util.Args
Creates a new instance of Args, ready for configuration.
Args.Matcher<T> - Class in util
Individual arguments & their parameters are captured by Matcher.

C

clear() - Method in class util.Args
Clears out arguments data set by match()

F

failed() - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Indicates whether there were user errors when validating this Matcher.
found() - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Indicates whether the argument was found in the user input.

G

getName() - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Obtains the name provided by the user for named (non-wildcard) arguments.
getParam(T) - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Obtains the parameter value.
getParam() - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Same as getParam(T) but returns null when no parameter was provided by the user.
getParams(List<T>) - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Obtains a list of values for multi-parameter arguments.
getParams() - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Obtains a list of values for multi-parameter arguments.
getUserErrors() - Method in class util.Args
Gets all the validation errors that happened during parsing.
getUserErrors(Appendable) - Method in class util.Args
Pretty-prints validation errors, one per line.

H

hasUserErrors() - Method in class util.Args
Finds out if we have validation errors.
help(Appendable) - Method in class util.Args
Prints a complete set of man-page-like help documentation based on configuration, including three sections, in order: synopsis, summary & options.
helpOptions(Appendable) - Method in class util.Args
Prints the "Options" section that appears last in help()'s output
helpSynopsisLine(Appendable) - Method in class util.Args
Prints the "Synopsis" line that appears at the top of help() output.

I

identify(Args.Matcher<?>) - Method in class util.Args
Exposed mainly for use with addError() and custom validation.

M

match(String[]) - Method in class util.Args
Compares Matchers to a typical String[] array from public static void main().

O

onlyIf(Args.Matcher<?>) - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Asserts that the argument is only valid when "other" is also present (order of arguments does not matter).

P

parseIntParam(String) - Static method in class util.Args.Matcher
A convenience function for integer conversion of raw String values.

S

setAllowParamDelimiterSkip() - Method in class util.Args
Allows syntax like "-F~" as a shortcut to "-F ~".
setAllowsParam() - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Indicates a named argument allows an optional parameter value.
setHelp(String...) - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Allows one to provide detailed help for a given argument; this will appear in the "Options" section for that argument.
setHelp(String...) - Method in class util.Args
Sets the detailed, introductory help information for the program.
setHelp(List<String>) - Method in class util.Args
Same as setHelp(String...) but using List instead.

Sets the name of the program printed in the "Synopsis" section of help, e.g.

Indicates this argument allows multiple parameter values, e.g.
setParamSample(String) - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
For printing sample usage in documentation output, e.g.
setRequired() - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Indicates that the argument is required.
setRequiredAndMultiParam() - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
A shortcut to setRequired().setMultiParam(); the argument AND at least one parameter value are required (for wildcards, the parameters are the argument itself, so the call is still valid and yields sensible results, i.e.
setRequiresMultiParam() - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
A shortcut to setRequiresParam().setMultiParam().
setRequiresParam() - Method in class util.Args.Matcher
Indicates a named argument requires a parameter value.

T
